text: Geodesy, sometimes called geodetics, is a scientific branch of geography which accurately measures the surface of the Earth. Friedrich Robert Helmert (18431917), who started the discipline, talked about measuring and mapping the surface of the earth. This includes its geometric description (the geoid) and the measurement and description of its gravitational field. Some people involved in the discipline look at geodynamics, the crusts, the tides, or the movement of the geographical poles. == Related pages == *Cartography
